!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.jdt.core 4 1008 2006-01-06 08:15:04.591
!MESSAGE Cannot retrieve the attached javadoc for FindSupport [in FindSupport.class [in org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime [in /opt/eclipse/installs/I20060105-0800-gtk/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.common_1.0.0.v20051205.jar [in org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor]]]]

Any idea how to reproduce?
What javadoc attachment do you have?

Steps to reproduce:

- I can only reproduce in my target workbench
- In any eclipse plug-in, create a class 'Foo' such as the following (| == caret):

public class Foo {
    Find|
}

- invoke code assist
- use the ARROW_UP/DOWN keys to select the proposal for org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.FindSupport

> the exception is thrown and written to the error log

I debugged through JavaElement::getURLContents. My findings:

- docUrlValue= "jar:file://opt/eclipse/installs/I20060110-1026-gtk/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv_3.2.0.v20060109.jar!/reference/api/org/eclipse/core/internal/runtime/FindSupport.html"

- the causing IOException happens when JarURLConnection::getInputStream is called; the exception gets swallowed and not included in the JavaModelException. See the stacktrace of the original exception below.

It seems that the URL is invalid / that JarURLConnection expects a different format - the "file:" reference does not seem to work.

perhaps the double slash (//) before the location is the problem? Just guessing.

Tom, you are right. The URL is not propertly encoded.
If the '//' before opt is replaced with '/', then it works as expected.
I'll try to determine when the url is encoded.
The bug comes from this location.
